title: How to Keep Your Dollhouse Furniture Safe

steps.headline: Beware the dangers of mold and mildew.
steps.description: In a damp climate this dangerous duo can sweep in and cause damage to your beautiful miniature home, especially to the wallpaper and upholstery.

steps.headline: Make sure that you keep your dollhouse in a location that is completely dry.
Avoid storing any doll house miniatures near windows because the condensation on the glass in the winter can make the dollhouse moist.
Look out for mildew.
steps.description: If your dollhouse has already suffered from mold you will be able to see it with the naked eye. Depending on the type of mold, it may appear white and powdery or even black.

steps.headline: Make sure that you inspect your dollhouse periodically and give all items a good cleaning every so often.
Realize the dangers of the sun.
steps.description: Another reason to keep your dollhouse away from the windows is because the strong sunshine can cause the paint colors to fade and can discolor the wood.

steps.headline: Avoid waiting until it's too late.
steps.description: You might not notice it at first, but after many years of sitting in the same spot you will see that the UV rays coming through the windows have caused damage to the dollhouse. If the sunlight gets very hot it can loosen the glue or soften plastic items – causing further damage to the house.

steps.headline: Keep the dollhouse somewhere cool and away from bright sunlight so that you can keep it preserved in its original condition for as long as possible.
Beware that pets and small chewable items are pretty incompatible.
steps.description: Cats love to play with things and dogs will chew anything that they can get their teeth on which is why your pets can be another enemy of your dollhouse furniture collection. If your furry friend gets a reproduction 17th century table in their mouth, it can be dangerous for them – because they can choke on the small pieces. In addition, other crafting items such as paint and glue can be toxic for your pets.

steps.headline: Make sure that you keep your dollhouse furniture and other accessories stored high up above the ground so that your dog cannot get them.
If you have a cat, you might want to keep your dollhouse craft center in a room where you can close the door and keep them out.
Clean regularly.
steps.description: Of course, over time dust will build up on your dollhouse and the furniture within it so It is important to dust on a regular basis. Dust buildup can actually damage your collection. Read this to find out how to get rid of dust. Dust is made up of tiny particles of dirt and skin and when it rests on a surface it can cause a number of minuscule scratches that can cause damage over time.

steps.headline: Give your dollhouse and furniture a wipe down with a dry or slightly damp cloth whenever you see dust accumulating.
steps.description: Depending on the type of wood that used to build the dollhouse, you might want to consider using a specific type of cleaner to give it a polish.

steps.headline: Avoid storing your dollhouse in hot areas.
steps.description: As mentioned in the section on sunshine, heat can be damaging to materials.

steps.headline: Beware of the cold, too.
steps.description: As well as being vulnerable to excessive heat many dollhouse materials also become very brittle when they are subjected to cold temperatures. This is especially true for plastic dollhouse furniture as it becomes very brittle when it is cold.

text: Mold and Mildew Beware the dangers of mold and mildew. In a damp climate this dangerous duo can sweep in and cause damage to your beautiful miniature home, especially to the wallpaper and upholstery. Make sure that you keep your dollhouse in a location that is completely dry.  Avoid storing any doll house miniatures near windows because the condensation on the glass in the winter can make the dollhouse moist.  Look out for mildew. If your dollhouse has already suffered from mold you will be able to see it with the naked eye. Depending on the type of mold, it may appear white and powdery or even black. Make sure that you inspect your dollhouse periodically and give all items a good cleaning every so often.  Strong Sunshine Realize the dangers of the sun. Another reason to keep your dollhouse away from the windows is because the strong sunshine can cause the paint colors to fade and can discolor the wood. Avoid waiting until it's too late. You might not notice it at first, but after many years of sitting in the same spot you will see that the UV rays coming through the windows have caused damage to the dollhouse. If the sunlight gets very hot it can loosen the glue or soften plastic items – causing further damage to the house. Keep the dollhouse somewhere cool and away from bright sunlight so that you can keep it preserved in its original condition for as long as possible.  Curious Pets Beware that pets and small chewable items are pretty incompatible. Cats love to play with things and dogs will chew anything that they can get their teeth on which is why your pets can be another enemy of your dollhouse furniture collection. If your furry friend gets a reproduction 17th century table in their mouth, it can be dangerous for them – because they can choke on the small pieces. In addition, other crafting items such as paint and glue can be toxic for your pets. Make sure that you keep your dollhouse furniture and other accessories stored high up above the ground so that your dog cannot get them.  If you have a cat, you might want to keep your dollhouse craft center in a room where you can close the door and keep them out.  Dust Clean regularly. Of course, over time dust will build up on your dollhouse and the furniture within it so It is important to dust on a regular basis. Dust buildup can actually damage your collection. Read this to find out how to get rid of dust. Dust is made up of tiny particles of dirt and skin and when it rests on a surface it can cause a number of minuscule scratches that can cause damage over time. Give your dollhouse and furniture a wipe down with a dry or slightly damp cloth whenever you see dust accumulating. Depending on the type of wood that used to build the dollhouse, you might want to consider using a specific type of cleaner to give it a polish. Extreme temperatures Avoid storing your dollhouse in hot areas. As mentioned in the section on sunshine, heat can be damaging to materials. Beware of the cold, too. As well as being vulnerable to excessive heat many dollhouse materials also become very brittle when they are subjected to cold temperatures. This is especially true for plastic dollhouse furniture as it becomes very brittle when it is cold.
